caption.p: Wintertime responses of temperature, westerly winds, and storm tracks. The wintertime (December–March) responses of a, b surface air temperature (K), c, d zonal-mean zonal winds (m s −1) and e, f transient eddy heat flux (10 7 W m −1) to mid-Holocene Arctic sea ice loss ( a, c, e) and insolation forcing ( b, d, f). Purple lines in c and d are climatological-mean zonal-mean zonal winds from the mid-Holocene with pre-industrial sea ice simulation. In e and f, the transient eddy heat flux at each pressure level is integrated from the surface to 700 hPa. For all the plots, statistically significant values ( p < 0.05) are hatched
